image.altText: A woman with sunglasses on outside court next to a camera operator

props.synopsis: Raelene Polymiadis, who allegedly murdered her elderly parents by injecting them with her prescription insulin, admits to breaching bail by attending a shopping centre in Adelaide's north in December 2023.

title.children: Murder-accused Raelene Polymiadis admits to shopping centre bail breach

image.altText: A small black cow is pulled from a hole

props.synopsis: A calf that fell down a well near Mount Gambier is safe and healthy after a lengthy rescue operation.

title.children: Moving scenes as calf reunited with mum after falling down well

image.altText: Jason Hagon is wearing a suit but no tie and walking next to a female reporter

props.synopsis: Jason Paul Hagon's six-year jail term for indecently assaulting nine female clients at his home-based business has been reduced by eight months on appeal.

title.children: Massage therapist's jail term for indecently assaulting clients reduced

image.altText: A woman holds a small black and white dog

props.synopsis: Laws introduced last year aim to make it easier for tenants to have pets in private rentals in South Australia. But some say it's making little difference on the ground, as renters continue to face high levels of competition amid an ongoing housing crisis.

title.children: Concerns renters with pets are still being rejected, despite law reform

image.altText: Fatal stabbing victim William Holdback.

props.synopsis: The mother of William Holdback, who was fatally stabbed on a suburban Adelaide street almost a year ago, has expressed her devastation as the two men charged with his murder enter not guilty pleas in court.

title.children: 'Worst nightmare': mother's grief as accused men deny murder charge

image.altText: Lisa Cunningham

props.synopsis: An Australian woman awaiting trial over the death of her stepdaughter is unable to leave jail because her bail has been set at a "terribly unfair" $US500,000, according to her lawyer.

title.children: SA woman awaiting trial over stepdaughter's death can't post bail, lawyer says

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair wearing a green shirt smiling in front of rolled up carpet

props.synopsis: The South Australian was turning off a light and heading to bed when lightning struck her house and sent a bolt through her arm.

title.children: Woman struck by lightning while turning off light in her home

image.altText: Ashley McGregor has a blonde beard and is wearing a blue stripy polo shirt and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A father has been found guilty of the manslaughter and criminal neglect of his 21-day-old son, who sustained injuries consistent with a high-impact car crash.

title.children: Father guilty of killing baby son whose injuries were like car crash victim's

image.altText: Staff follow Mathew Hawkins outside the hotel moments before he punches Luke Sweetman

props.synopsis: South Australia's Supreme Court has released footage of Mathew Hawkins's fatal one-punch attack on Luke Sweetman — who was backing away — when he was struck outside a suburban Adelaide hotel.

title.children: Final moments of 'fun-loving' man killed in one-punch attack released by court

image.altText: cracked dry soil surrounded by dry shrub

props.synopsis: An invisible disaster is unfolding in South Australia, and those impacted want a future plan to make sure they have enough water to survive, writes Meagan Dillon.

title.children: 'Water is a basic need': An invisible disaster is unfolding in South Australia

image.altText: An x-ray of a baby who swallowed a button battery.

props.synopsis: Baby Adèle is now on the road to recovery, but two months ago she was in intensive care after swallowing a button battery, leaving her parents completely petrified and fearing "she might not make it".

title.children: Button battery nightmare prompts parents to keep technology sealed

image.altText: A man lays on the ground with a tree branch strewn across a driveway surrounded by emergency services personnel

props.synopsis: An Adelaide couple has escaped serious injuries after they were hit by a falling tree branch in their driveway on Tuesday – a day after a festival-goer was taken to hospital when a branch fell during WOMAD. Warning: This story contains graphic images.

title.children: Adelaide couple injured in second falling tree branch incident this week

image.altText: Outside the Broken Hill Correctional Centre

props.synopsis: A 28-year-old man who allegedly escaped from a Broken Hill prison has been recaptured following a two-day manhunt. A second alleged escapee is back in custody, and the two have been given additional charges.

title.children: Second alleged prison escapee recaptured in Broken Hill

image.altText: An iPhone turned on its side with a white Australian Super logo displayed on the screen.

props.synopsis: An Australian Super member has hit out at the fund for delays in processing an insurance claim for disability related payments. His case comes as corporate watchdog ASIC issues a warning to super funds that delay death and disability payments to their members.

title.children: 'Impacted my life': Australian Super member says delays in claim almost left him homeless

image.altText: Trump and Musk look out the open driver's side door of a red Tesla

props.synopsis: Donald Trump turned the White House lawn into a Tesla showroom on Tuesday as he attempted to buoy his ally's brand. But can he even drive the car he bought?

title.children: Why Donald Trump can’t drive the Tesla he just bought

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The government is banking on voters appreciating that this time around with Trump is different.

title.children: Gone is Albanese's softly-softly approach towards Trump

image.altText: Aboriginal child wearing brightly coloured shirt reading 'Reading opens doors'.

props.synopsis: Those in the Indigenous community have become used to hearing dire statistics, all for them to be ignored or not acted upon, time and time again.

title.children: Closing the Gap data shames states, who are all too willing to ignore it

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley sits with her dogs.

props.synopsis: A jury has heard Rajwinder Singh is a "coward" who became the target of a "flawed" police investigation after witnessing Queensland woman Toyah Cordingley’s murder on a secluded beach.

title.children: Toyah Cordingley's accused killer 'saw murder' and 'handled it badly', jury told

image.altText: A man with grey hair and wearing a suit standing outside a court in busy Sydney CBD.

props.synopsis: A jury has found former Australian cricketer Stuart MacGill guilty of taking part in the supply of cocaine in Sydney.

title.children: Former cricketer Stuart MacGill found guilty over cocaine deal

image.altText: The two divers in the water after being spotted by crew members on board Rottnest Fast Ferries.

props.synopsis: A man who was picked up by a Perth ferry after his dive boat left him behind says failing to account for every diver before leaving a site is unacceptable.

title.children: Scuba diver left behind in ocean welcomes safety investigation

image.altText: Jack Doohan holding a microphone, attending a press conference.

props.synopsis: Australian Formula 1 rookie Jack Doohan insists Alpine's decision to sign Argentine Franco Colapinto as a reserve driver has not added more pressure on him.

title.children: Jack Doohan says it is not just Franco Colapinto chasing his Alpine drive

image.altText: Max Verstappen, outdoors in Melbourne at a promotional day for Red Bull, wearing merchandise

props.synopsis: Max Verstappen has won the last four Formula 1 world championships, but by his own admission enters the 2025 season with a car that is not the quickest on grid.

title.children: Chasing history, Verstappen arrives in Melbourne without the quickest car

image.altText: Five member of The Cruel Sea pose by a yellow pick-up track and panel shed.

props.synopsis: Australian icons The Cruel Sea still sound as relevant as ever in 2025. Plus, four more recent album recommendations.

title.children: Australian post-punk legends return with first album in 24 years

image.altText: A prefab module for an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Prefab housing has been touted as the answer to Australia's housing supply for years, but it's an industry plagued with high costs, low scale and a desperate need for investment if it's ever going to be a solution.

title.children: Sweden builds houses in days, Australia tried to do that 50 years ago

image.altText: A bucket sits in a large amount of foamy milk.

props.synopsis: Dairy farmers in NSW and Queensland have been forced to discard vast quantities of their product as road damage renders their properties inaccessible to trucks.

title.children: Thousands of litres of milk dumped as flood damage cuts off farms

image.altText: A South Korean soldier gestures near a bomb accident site

props.synopsis: The two pilots were charged with criminal negligence over the accidental bombing, which injured at least 29 people.

title.children: South Korea charges air force pilots over accidental bombing of village

image.altText: A man and a woman in blue spacesuits pose for a photo, smiling.

props.synopsis: The mission for the return of two astronauts stranded on the International Space Station was scrubbed over a technical issue with the rocket's launch pad.

title.children: SpaceX delays mission to replace NASA's stranded astronauts

image.altText: Two Indigenous women, one elderly and the other middle-aged, cuddle up as they gold an award in a school quadrangle.

props.synopsis: Theresa Napurrurla Ross was taught to read and write in her own language by her mother, and followed in her footsteps. Half a century on, their legacy continues to change lives.

title.children: Trailblazing mum and daughter celebrate 50 years of bilingual education

image.altText: Fugitive Lalit Modi is surrounded by Indian police officers at an airport in New Delhi

props.synopsis: Lalit Modi was the man who founded the lucrative Indian Premier League, then fled India. Now, he's trying to ditch his Indian passport for Vanuatu's.

title.children: Vanuatu regrets 'golden passport' for fugitive Indian ex-cricket boss

image.altText: A head and shoulders profile shot of Terence John Fisher posing for a photo with a bushy beard.

props.synopsis: Evolving DNA technology helps WA Police identify Terence John Fisher as the man they suspect killed Perth woman Kerryn Tate 45 years ago, with his name also linked to two other unsolved murders.

title.children: Police name suspect in 1979 cold case murder after DNA breakthrough

image.altText: Four young girls wearing red headbands with white feathers stand in a line and smile.

props.synopsis: Traditional owners say the newly dedicated Central Western Desert IPA has been a long time coming and is another "little jigsaw" piece in their efforts to protect the landscape.

title.children: New Indigenous protected area spanning 4m hectares 'a jewel' for all

image.altText: Pope Francis in a wheelchair

props.synopsis: The Vatican says a recent chest scan confirmed improvements in the pope's condition, as the 88-year-old battles double pneumonia.

title.children: Pope Francis remains stable, chest scan confirms improvements

image.altText: Grey seal looking upwards with a blurred GPS tracking device glued on its back.

props.synopsis: Once on the brink of extinction, the rare marine mammal's population is rising thanks to conservation efforts.

title.children: Mediterranean monk seals are making a remarkable comeback
